snippet: A photograph of hungry Palestinians in Syria, retweeted more than eight million times, has become an iconic image of the war. Experts said it was real.
abstract: United Nations photograph showing sea of hungry Palestinians awaiting emergency food amid detritus of bomb-ravaged neighborhood near Damascus has been retweeted more than eight million times over several weeks; image, which has become emblematic of Syrian civil war, has prompted accusations that it was digitally faked; Chris Gunness, UN official responsible for distributing the photo, has denied charge.
lead_paragraph: A photograph of hungry Palestinians in Syria, retweeted more than eight million times, has become an iconic image of the war. Experts said it was real.

headline.main: U.N. Denies That Syria Image Was Faked
headline.print_headline: A Disquieting Image, Yes, but It Is Real, an Official Says

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
